Class MyHTTPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unifi.rc.httpserver.m5765968.MyHTTPServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HTTPServer

    public class MyHTTPServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements HTTPServer
    This class implements the HTTPServer interface with the respective methods to manage a server object.
    Author:
    Mattia D'Autilia

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyHTTPServer

        public MyHTTPServer(int port,
                    int backlog,
                    java.net.InetAddress address,
                    HTTPHandler... handlers)
        Creates a MyHTTPServer object by assigning the respective port, backlog, address and the various handlers.
        Parameters:
        port - Indicates the server port to which the client accesses.
        backlog - Indicates the series of operations waiting to be performed by a server.
        address - Indicates the server address.
        handlers - Indicates the handlers that handle the request.

    • Method Detail

      • addHandler

        public void addHandler(HTTPHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: HTTPServer
        Adds a new handler in the server. Each server has a list of HTTPHandler. A request is handled by the first handler that is able to handle it.
        Specified by:
        addHandler in interface HTTPServer
        Parameters:
        handler - an HTTPHandler.

           throws java.io.IOException
